0: Christ, Who called you Mother and the Blessed One,* accepted the passion of His own free will.* In His desire to find the fallen Adam,* He caused light to shine from His cross in order to search him out.* Then He said to the angels:* Rejoice with Me, for I have found the lost piece of silver.* Glory to You, O God,* who accomplished all things in such wisdom!
1: The announcement of Gabriel to the Virgin* was the beginning of salvation,* for she heard the salutation and did not flee from the greeting,* nor did she doubt as did Sarah in the tent.* She proclaimed instead: Behold the handmaid of the Lord.* Be it done to me according to your word.
2: O virgin Mother of God, good hope of the world,* we seek no other help than your power.* Have compassion for your people who have no other protector* and intercede with the merciful God* that He may save our souls from all dangers,* for you are the only blessed one.
3: O virgin Mother of God,* pray to your Son, Christ our God, who delivered the world from error when He accepted willingly to be crucified, that He may have mercy on our souls.
4: Holy and pure Lady, virgin Mother of our God,* who gave birth to the Creator of all in a manner beyond description;* together with the apostles pray without ceasing to his goodness,* that He may save us from our passions* and grant us remission of our sins.
5: O virgin Mother of God,* pray to your Son, Christ our God, who delivered the world from error when He accepted willingly to be crucified, that He may have mercy on our souls.
